before_start: {"blocks":[{"key":"ec06k","text":"Useful tips and tricks: ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4q0a5","text":"Pay attention to the glass stoppers, which may break due to overpressure in the separation funnel. It is better to use the aluminum foil from the combustion as lids during extraction, and only use the stoppers during liquid-liquid extraction.","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"39acu","text":"For a longer phase separation, add DCM and MilliQ already after the first extraction step.","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fp2qt","text":"For 250 mL separation funnels, the best Teflon valves are the ones with the larger hole. Work best with the small O-rings.","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"51oon","text":"Remember to clean the six-way gas tap with DCM:MeOH 5:1 and let it dry with minimal gas flow.","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"36to0","text":"During drawing off of the organic layer in the separation funnel, it is better to leave a small amount of the organic layer instead of risking also drawing off any of the aqueous phases.","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"26rs9","text":"Distinctly mark and label the Teflon tube, separation funnel, Schott bottle, and TurboVap\nThe vial will be used for the same sample.","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
description: {"blocks":[{"key":"3fv17","text":"This updated Bligh and Dyer method is based on Xavier Prieto's protocol \"OrgGeochem - Met007.1- Extraction of sediment samples using the Bligh and Dyer method\" (review by Marcus Elvert, dated 01.01.2006). Since the original 2006 protocol, there have been several small changes and minor adjustments. This protocol outlines a way to perform the Bligh and Dyer extraction with modern equipment and provides useful tips and tricks.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3nhbb","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"723e","text":"The protocol includes the following steps:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2lg85","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6vh4u","text":"Freeze-drying of sediment samples.","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bosep","text":"Performing the Bligh and Dyer extraction on sediment samples.","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"c99uo","text":"Evaporation and storage of the total lipid extract (TLE).","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
disclaimer: {"blocks":[{"key":"7l1hc","text":"DISCLAIMER – FOR WORKGROUP INTERNAL USE AND INFORMATIONAL PURPOSE ONLY; USE AT YOUR OWN RISK","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7qirh","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"c7q48","text":"This protocol is intended primarily for internal use within our working group, but others are welcome to utilize it. The content provided here is for informational purposes only and should not be considered as legal, medical, clinical, or safety advice. It’s important to note that content added to protocols.io is not peer-reviewed and might not have undergone formal approval. Therefore, the information in this protocol should not replace independent professional judgment, advice, diagnosis, or treatment. Any actions taken based on this protocol, whether in adherence or reliance upon the information presented, are done solely at your own risk. By using this protocol, you acknowledge that neither our Company nor any authors, contributors, administrators, or anyone else associated with protocols.io can be held responsible for your use of the information in this protocol or related Sites/Apps and Services.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
guidelines: {"blocks":[{"key":"b6dul","text":"Freeze drying of sediment samples","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"v5pa","text":"Modified Bligh and Dyer extraction of sediment samples","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3cs2b","text":"Evaporation and storage of total lipid extract (TLE)","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
materials_text:
{"blocks":[{"key":"l4gv","text":"1. Abbreviations
","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":16}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"799i8","text":"HCl: Hydrochloric Acid","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":1,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fsjld","text":"K2HPO4: Potassium Hydrogenphosphate","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":1,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"701nt","text":"Na2HPO4: Sodium Hydrogenphosphate","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":1,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ds7lt","text":"TCA: Trichloroacetic Acid","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":1,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6ga9g","text":"C16 PAF: 1-O-Hexadecyl-2-Acetoyl-sn-Glycero-3-Phosphocholine","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":1,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3v7h8","text":"DCM: Dichloromethane","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":1,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"80jcf","text":"MeOH: Methanol","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":1,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ccoi0","text":"Na2SO4: Sodium Sulfate","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":1,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"39hhu","text":"","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":1,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dti3g","text":"2. Materials & Reagents
","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":23}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cs2n5","text":"100 mL centrifuge Teflon vials with lids","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9rirs","text":"Centrifuge","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6vuig","text":"Pre-combusted measuring cylinder","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8ark1","text":"Pre-combusted Pasteur pipettes","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cj3u8","text":"250 mL pre-combusted separation funnel (with Teflon valves and glass stoppers)","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ce5im","text":"250 mL pre-combusted glass container (Schott bottles)","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"mvl3","text":"200 mL pre-combusted TurboVap vial with conic ending and TurboVap evaporation system","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2l3hk","text":"3. Reagents:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":12}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"e0mvm","text":"HCl, 37% (e.g., Carl-Roth, Ref. 9277.1)","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1st4h","text":"K2HPO4 (e.g., Carl-Roth, Ref. T749.1)","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bm5kn","text":"Na2HPO4 x 12 H2O (e.g., Carl-Roth, Ref. T106.1)","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"804v3","text":"Trichloroacetic acid (e.g., Sigma Aldrich, Ref. T6399)","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ekfhg","text":"C16 PAF (e.g., Avanti Polar Lipids, Ref. 878110)","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6cr6g","text":"Methanol, Chromasolv (e.g., Sigma Aldrich, Ref. 34885)","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"d3v0o","text":"Dichloromethane, puriss. p.a. (e.g., Fluka, Ref. 66740)","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4pcvs","text":"Sodium sulfate (Na2SO4) >99.5% (e.g., Normapur VWR, Ref. 28114.296)","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fkgo4","text":"4. Protection Measures
HCl is toxic and corrosive.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":22}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"efquu","text":"TCA causes severe burns and is very toxic to aquatic organisms, potentially causing long-term adverse effects.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7alg3","text":"Dichloromethane is suspected to be carcinogenic.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dos8n","text":"Methanol is highly flammable, toxic, and can be absorbed through the skin.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4lc77","text":"Handle solvents under a fume hood and wear a laboratory coat, safety glasses, and gloves at all times. Avoid contact with HCl, TCA, DCM, and Methanol or inhaling their vapors.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"af4ds","text":"5. Preparation of Buffer Solutions/Extraction Mixes/Equipment","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":61}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"agpmm","text":"6N HCl solution: Mix 294 mL of concentrated HCl (37%) with 206 mL of MilliQ water.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3rulo","text":"HCl pH = 2 solution for acid wash: For each 1 L of MilliQ, add 1.3 mL of 20% HCl.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7qqdr","text":"50 mM Phosphate buffer: Dissolve 8.7 g K2HPO4 (or 18.0 g Na2HPO4 x 12 H2O) in 1 L MilliQ water, and add 3.5 mL of a 6N HCl solution (final pH should be 7.4).","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"clho1","text":"50 mM TCA buffer: Dissolve 50 g of trichloroacetic acid in 1 L MilliQ water.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"787fv","text":"1 L Phosphate buffer mix: Combine 211 mL Phosphate buffer, 263 mL DCM, and 526 mL MeOH.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ckq60","text":"1 L TCA buffer mix: Combine 211 mL TCA buffer, 263 mL DCM, and 526 mL MeOH.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1qps2","text":"1 L Saturated NaCl solution: Dissolve > 360 g NaCl in 1 L MilliQ (it's okay if not all salt dissolves).","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7517p","text":"Pasteur pipettes packed with sodium sulfate: Use a small piece of combusted glass wool to prevent Na2SO4 from passing through the pipette. Fill the pipette with Na2SO4 (1-2 cm below the tight part).","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

status.info: We use this protocol and it's working

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"3cvta","text":"      Take your samples out of the freezer","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"f6e6h","text":"      Cover the container with aluminum foil ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"c4mu8","text":"      Poke little holes in the foil (syringe needles/ Pasteur pipettes work best)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"3s3ts","text":"      Follow freeze dryer instructions you find in the manual next to the machine","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"3bfq","text":"Freeze your samples (\u003c -20°C) ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"dptif","text":"Cover the container with aluminium foil ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"l8ne","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"6q31l","text":"Take your samples out of the freezer","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"e22fr","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"28rqu","text":"Poke little holes in the foil (syringe needles/ Pasteur pipettes work best)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"7vunn","text":"Measure out X.XX grams of freeze-dried sediment into a 100 ml Teflon centrifuge vial","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"c94sd","text":"Add Bligh and Dyer phosphate extraction mix (5-10 mL per 1 g of freeze-dried sediment)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"61r7v","text":"follow freeze dryer instructions you find in the manual next to the machine","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"46r56","text":"Add the standards to the sediment ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"7rg5p","text":"For LC-MS analysis, add e.g. PC21 (0.5 µg / 1 g of freeze-dried sediment)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"fv2b9","text":"For GC-MS analysis, add GC-STD-Mix (1 µg / 1 g of freeze-dried sediment)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"iopn","text":"Sonicate for 10 minutes in an ultrasonic bath ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"6vsm8","text":"Centrifuge for 10 minutes at 2000rpm ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"6t0l8","text":"Decant the supernatant (solvent) into the separation funnel with closed valves!!! (use\nPasteur pipette if necessary) ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"9f4de","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4u02p","text":"Repeat steps 3 to 6 one more time (1x) with the same amount of phosphate buffer","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":35,"length":2}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7e5ha","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"9rmk3","text":"Repeat steps 3 to 6 two more times (2x) using the TCA buffer instead ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":36,"length":2}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"a8pup","text":"Add DCM and MilliQ to the separation funnel to separate the solution (5-10 mL DCM and 5-10 mL MilliQ (or sat. NaCl solution for faster separation) per 1 g of freeze-dried sediments)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"4ob55","text":"Invert/shake the separation funnel to mix and wait for layers to separate – they can be cloudy, and it could take several minutes ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"9t4hr","text":"Draw off the organic layer (bottom) into a pre-combusted 250 mL Shott bottle","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"rmlr","text":"Extract the aqueous fraction three times (3x) with DCM (  per 1 g freeze-dried\nsediment) and combine DCM extracts with the  DCM layer (discard aqueous fraction)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":42,"length":2}],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":56,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"73ldn","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"5-10","error":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":2}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"fdssh","text":"Extract the organic fraction 3 times (3x) with MiliQ (5-10 mL per 1 g freeze-dried sediment) each time\ndiscarding aqueous fraction – this step is not necessarily mandatory but helps clean the TLE","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":38,"length":2}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8c3ov","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"5tqv0","text":"Transfer the TLE extract from the glass container to an   TurboVap vial (wash Shott bottle several times with DCM and add to TurboVap vial until clean)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":56,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"62dlv","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"200","error":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":2}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"23qpu","text":"Evaporate DCM from the total lipid extract under a flux of nitrogen in the\nTurboVap evaporator to ~  at no more than   ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":99,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":117,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"55fd1","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"1","error":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":2}},"1":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"37","unit":10}}}}

steps.section: Transfer into 4 mL vial and drying over Sodium sulphate
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"a79t4","text":" After evaporation, transfer the TLE into a new labeled and weighted (with lids) pre-combusted 4 mL vial. Again, wash the sample residues in the TurboVap vial with DCM until clean","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Transfer into 4 mL vial and drying over Sodium sulphate
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"f782t","text":"Evaporate the TLE solution to complete dryness (unless you still observe water in your TLE to continue with 23.1) under the six-way gas tap under the fume hood. For faster evaporation, use the heating block and a heating plate at no more than 37°C","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Transfer into 4 mL vial and drying over Sodium sulphate
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"1oa3k","text":"Following steps are also not necessarily mandatory, only if you feel or see that your TLE still contains water","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Transfer into 4 mL vial and drying over Sodium sulphate
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"bfmtu","text":"Evaporate the TLE to ~0.5 mL under the six-way gas tap under the fume hood to complete dryness (remove as soon the sample is dry). For faster evaporation, use the heating block and a heating plate","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Transfer into 4 mL vial and drying over Sodium sulphate
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"82md2","text":"Wash Pasteur pipette packed with sodium sulfate 3–4 times with DCM ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Transfer into 4 mL vial and drying over Sodium sulphate
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"24a16","text":"Put new labeled and weighted (with lids) pre-combusted 4 mL under the Pasteur pipette and pass TLE through the pipette to get rid of residual water (wash 4 mL vial with DCM until clean)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Transfer into 4 mL vial and drying over Sodium sulphate
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"9evdm","text":"Pass as much DCM through the column as needed to fill the   vial","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":58,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"bjv","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"4","error":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":2}}}}

steps.section: Transfer into 4 mL vial and drying over Sodium sulphate
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"53f21","text":"Evaporate the TLE under the six-way gas tap under the fume hood to complete dryness (remove as soon the sample is dry). For faster evaporation use the heating block and a heating plate","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"dqhtg","text":"Weigh the   vials with TLE and lids to calculate the yield","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":10,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"7plpu","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"4","error":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":2}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"acpii","text":"Store dried TLE at   until analysis","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":19,"length":1}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"-20","unit":10}}}}

title: Extraction of sediment samples using a modified Bligh and Dyer method: Hinrichs Lab

warning: {"blocks":[{"key":"ahced","text":"Protection measures","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":19}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dl7bj","text":"HCl is toxic and corrosive.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"83u53","text":"TCA causes severe burns and is very toxic to aquatic organisms. It may cause long-term adverse effects in the aquatic environment.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fuu61","text":"Dichloromethane is suspected to be a carcinogenic substance.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5er4u","text":"Methanol is highly inflammable, and toxic, and can be absorbed through the skin.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"e7o36","text":" ","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fao6u","text":"Solvents must be handled under the fume hood. Laboratory coat, safety glasses, and gloves must be worn during the whole procedure. Special care should be taken to avoid contact with HCl, TCA, DCM and Methanol or inhaling its vapors.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":232}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
